title: Torrentem
description: Torrentem is a parallel CPU/GPU multi-physics solver library developed in C++ to be the key driver in my PhD research. Developed for power and flexibility, it implements advanced numerical techniques such as RBVMS and stabilized finite element formulations, a level-set method, custom GPU-based linear solvers, and a mesh partitioning and MPI communication model for parallel CPU on multi-node HPCs. Currently closed source.

title: Ostium
description: Ostium is a library to process and integrate geospatial data, designed to work with Torrentem.

title: Vadum
description: Vadum provides visualisation tools for results generated by Torrentem.
